description.narrative: The Project offers innovative policy and programming solutions to activate Roma, youth and people with disability in the open labour market while promoting services for broader social inclusion

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Output 1 Indicators: 1.1: Number of persons (persons with disabilities, Roma, youth) gained access to gainful employment or self-employment 1.2: Number of persons (persons with disabilities, Roma, youth) gained access to improved vocational skills 1.3: Number of persons with disabilities completed the vocational rehabilitation process 1.4: Number of Roma and non-Roma (women and men) that enrolled in adult primary / education
Output 2 Indicators: 2.1: Number of private businesses, including social enterprises, which provided on-job training for members of vulnerable groups in their premises 2.2: Number of private businesses, including social enterprises, have been assisted in screening and defining their workforce requirements 2.3: Number of companies supported to access ALMMs for employment of vulnerable groups 2.4: Number of private businesses, including social enterprises, have been assisted in defining the training programme and in training suitable candidates in needed skills and qualifications 2.5: Number of social enterprises have received tailor-made support for improving their business performances and create new jobs accessible to members of vulnerable groups based on the results of the analyses of social enterprises
Output 3 Indicators: 3.1: Number of new policies and services introduced to support the employment of the target vulnerable groups (REHA centre, youth employment centre, Roma employment centre, EDU offices in the centres, work experience placement, integrated case management) 3.2: Number of representatives/DPOs of the vulnerable groups that are fully included in all processes during defining policy recommendations on employment measures 3.3: Number of recommendations for introducing new ALLMs / services provided to the national and local authorities 3.4: Number of ESA staff members have attained introductory knowledge and skills in implementing integrated case management processes 3.5: Number of ESA staff in 30 Employment Centres are qualifi

comment.narrative:
Output 1 (ESA, 2017): 1.1: Number of persons gained access to gainful employment or self-employment: 1.1.1: Persons with disabilities: 48 full-time employments; thereof 42 self-employments (33% women) 1.1.2: Roma: 51 full-time employments; thereof 19 self-employments (16% women); 84 part-time employments 1.1.3: Youth: 965; thereof 358 self-employments (31% women) 1.2: Number of persons gained access to improved vocational skills: 1.2.1: Persons with disabilities: 13 1.2.2: Roma: 25 1.2.3: Youth: 295 1.3: Number of persons with disabilities completed the vocational rehabilitation process: 14 1.4: Number of Roma and non-Roma (women and men) that enrolled in adult primary / education: 18
Output 2 (ESA, 2017): 2.1: Number of private businesses, including social enterprises, which provided on-job training for members of vulnerable groups in their premises: 13 2.2: Number of private businesses, including social enterprises, have been assisted in screening and defining their workforce requirements: 0 2.3: Number of companies supported to access ALMMs for employment of vulnerable groups: n/a 2.4: Number of private businesses, including social enterprises, have been assisted in defining the training programme and in training suitable candidates in needed skills and qualifications: 1 2.5: Number of social enterprises have received tailor-made support for improving their business performances and create new jobs accessible to members of vulnerable groups based on the results of the analyses of social enterprises: 6
Output 3 - Baseline: 3.1: Number of new policies and services introduced to support the employment of the target vulnerable groups (REHA centre, youth employment centre, Roma employment centre, EDU offices in the centres, work experience placement, integrated case management): 0 3.2: Number of representatives/DPOs of the vulnerable groups that are fully included in all processes during defining policy recommendations on employment measures: n/a 3.3: Number of rec
